main.name: Amanda Steinhauer
main.bio: I am a passionate learner that uses my problem-solving skills to create solutions that improves the lives of others. I have studied computer engineering at the University of Toronto and have used my knowledge of software to develop such solutions like an iOS health app that to manage cardiovascular disease or a machine learning model that detects toxicity online communities. I would love to keep learning and working on projects that contribute to the improvement of society.

resume.skillmessage: I have experience using a wide range of languages, tools and frameworks that enable me to create cool projects

education.degree: Bachelors of Applied Science in Computer Engineering

work.title: Software Engineer II -> Software Engineer III
points: Developed 100+ scalable and reusable UI components using React.js, Typescript, and ES6+
Developed responsive and interactive features using React.js, Typescript, JavaScript, HTML and CSS to increase user engagement
Developed RESTful APIs used to fetch and display dynamic data, ensuring seamless user experiences and real-time updates for a web application with 1000s of concurrent users
Integrated with third-party APIs such as Zendesk to provide more flexibility to users
Mentored 2 intern developers to help them improve their technical abilities and confidence in software development, resulting in positive feedback from participants
Utilized Redux for state management in a complex application, improving data flow and reducing the need for prop drilling, which simplified component structure and maintenance
Worked in an Agile environment on a cross-functional team of 10, participating in daily stand-ups, sprint planning, and retrospectives to ensure timely delivery of features and improvements

work.title: Associate Engineer
points: Created ETL data pipelines that scheduled, extracted, processed, and exported relevant data using python, SQL, spark and AWS to form datasets that delivered insights into the works created by users
Built website pages and components using ReactJS, redux and JavaScript to increase user satisfaction and facilitate data collection
Developed similarity models using python with natural language processing techniques (doc2vec, tfidf, etc.) and built a web service and API for the model to be used
Engineered a LSTM-CRF named entity recognition model to identify the characters in a text with 98% precision
Developed a comment toxicity detection model with 65% accuracy to identify harmful comments on the platform to keep the community safe

work.title: Student Developer
points: Developed various web applications using C#, Go, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS
Performed extensive testing on web applications to ensure functionality and performance requirements were met
Improved the performance of a custom JSON de-serializer by 120%

work.title: Counselor
points: Taught students to program games and web applications, such as a website hosting a custom snake game using JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS
Assisted students with understanding C++ image detection and processing programs used in the robots for the camp
Used version control software (SVN) and unit testing to ensure students always had a working copy of their programs

project.title: Cat TV
project.description: A web application built in Python using Flask and SQL to provide entertaining videos to enrich the lives indoor cats

project.title: Apollog
project.description: An iOS app built using Swift that allows users to remotely monitor cardiovascular disease using symptoms, medications, and heart vitals collected from wearables
points: Designed and built user interfaces to meet usability standards and accessibility guidelines
Completed user research and system usability testing to guide app updates and increase user satisfaction by 10%
Designed, implemented, and maintained databases using Google Firebase
Collaborated with other students using Git and GitHub to manage and back-up code
Implemented code guidelines and developed documentation to improve app efficiency
